news_finder.routes package#

Submodules#

news_finder.routes.admin module#

async news_finder.routes.admin.add_admin() → Response[source]#

Change the “admin” field of one or more user(s) to true

# Json structure: (checked using schema validation)

{
    "names": [
        "username",
        ...
    ]
}
async news_finder.routes.admin.is_admin() → Response[source]#

Check if a user is an admin.

# Json structure: (checked using schema validation)

{
    "name": "username"
}

news_finder.routes.article module#

async news_finder.routes.article.get_articles() → Response[source]#

Get a json with all the articles and their news source. set the amount and offset parameters to specify a range of articles to retrieve.

# Articles json structure:

{
    "articles": [
        {
            "source": "www.vrt.be",
            "article": {
                "title": "Is the cat still there?",
                "description": "The most interesting article about a cat in a tree."
                "photo": "https://www.test-photo.io",
                "link": "https:foo.article/article1.html"
            }
        },
        {
            "source": "www.vrt.be",
            "article": {
                "title": "Is the cat already there?",
                "description": "The most interesting article about a cat on its way home."
                "photo": null
                "link": "https:foo.article/article2.html"
        },
        ...
    ]
}

news_finder.routes.error.generic_error(e: Exception) → Response[source]#

news_finder.routes.root.healthcheck() → Response[source]#

news_finder.routes.rss module#

async news_finder.routes.rss.add_rss_feed() → Response[source]#

Add rss feeds to database for scraping later on. The news source will be extracted from the hostname of the url.

# Feed json structure: (checked using schema validation)

{
    "feeds": [
        "https://www.vrt.be/vrtnws/nl.rss.articles.xml",
        ...
    ]
}
async news_finder.routes.rss.delete_rss() → Response[source]#

Delete rss feeds from the database

# Feed json structure: (checked using schema validation)

{
    "feeds": [
        "https://www.vrt.be/vrtnws/nl.rss.articles.xml",
        ...
    ]
}
async news_finder.routes.rss.get_rss_feeds() → Response[source]#

Get a json with all the rss feeds and their news source

# Feeds json structure:

{
    "feeds": [
        {
            "source": "www.vrt.be",
            "feed": "https://www.vrt.be/vrtnws/nl.rss.articles.xml"
        }.
        ...
    ]
}

news_finder.routes.user module#

async news_finder.routes.user.create_cookie_for_user(user_id: int) → str[source]#

Tries to generate cookie for user and inserts into database.

async news_finder.routes.user.delete_user()[source]#

Delete a user.

# Json structure: (checked using schema validation)

{
    "username": "user1"
}
async news_finder.routes.user.login_status() → Response[source]#

Check whether a user is logged in based on their cookie.

async news_finder.routes.user.login_user() → Response[source]#

Log a user in.

# Json structure: (checked using schema validation)

{
    "username": "user1"
    "password": "qwerty"
}
async news_finder.routes.user.logout_user() → Response[source]#

Log a user out.

async news_finder.routes.user.register_user() → Response[source]#

Create a user.

# Json structure: (checked using schema validation)

{
    "username": "user1"
    "password": "qwerty"
}
